issue.title: If you put in this valid 4-stop css3 gradient, it gets mangled
issue.body:
Super-bummed about this. I was really hoping SASS would work, but it's mangling my CSS3--these mixins are where it provides all the value, it's a shame to have them not workin'.

``` css
@mixin linGrad
  background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient (top, rgb(255,190,75) 0%, rgb(255,150,30) 50%, rgb(250,130,0) 50%, rgb(230,110,0) 100%)
  background-image: -moz-linear-gradient (top, rgb(255,190,75) 0%, rgb(255,150,30) 50%, rgb(250,130,0) 50%, rgb(230,110,0) 100%)
  background-image: -ms-linear-gradient (top, rgb(255,190,75) 0%, rgb(255,150,30) 50%, rgb(250,130,0) 50%, rgb(230,110,0) 100%)
  background-image: -o-linear-gradient (top, rgb(255,190,75) 0%, rgb(255,150,30) 50%, rgb(250,130,0) 50%, rgb(230,110,0) 100%)
  background-image: linear-gradient (top, rgb(255,190,75) 0%, rgb(255,150,30) 50%, rgb(250,130,0) 50%, rgb(230,110,0) 100%)

.button.onDark.orange
  +linGrad
```

issue.title: Thousandth Precision of Percentage Function Inadequate

body:
This is again an issue in whatever new release of SASS. 

I have a "_scaffolding.scss" file that is imported by all my main .scss files. In it are all my common imports and my @charset declaration. All of the sudden my files show `@charset "IBM437"` after updating to the most recent version of SASS. It is fixed when I put the declaration on the actual .scss file.

@ultimatedelman I don't completely understand the issue you're reporting. Can you post an example of the file or files that are producing the issue, as well as the output you expect and the output you're actually receiving?

ok let's say i have a file `main.scss` that generates a `main.css` file. let's also say i have a file named `_partial1.scss` in my `/partials/` folder.

my `main.scss` file looks like this:

`@import "partials/_partial1";`

and my `_partial1.scss` file looks like this:

`@charset "utf-8";`

the `main.css` file output then looks like this:

`@charset "IBM437";` 

instead of:

`@charset "utf-8";`
you know what, i realized i'm probably posting this in the wrong spot. this is probably a Compass issue. I'm sorry!

That may still be a Sass issue. Sass has a lot of internal `@charset` handling.

Do either of your files have any non-ASCII characters in them at all? What do you get if you run `ruby -e 'p [Encoding.default_internal, Encoding.default_external]'` on the command line?

issue.title: Support nested maps in sass:map functions

labels.name: planned
labels.description: We would like to add this feature at some point

labels.name: specs written
labels.description: Specs have been written for the feature and at least one implementation passes them

issue.title: Interpolation Regression in 4.0
issue.body:
If a identifier ends with parens indicating it is a function call. E.g. `un#{quo}te(asdf)` then in Sass 3.5: we get `unquote(asdf)` as output but in Sass 4.0 we get `unquo te(asdf)` (note: the introduction of a space).

According to @nex3 this is an unintended change.

issue.title: "Fixnum is deprecated" // warning while converting scss to css
issue.body:
**I tried to create a flex based css when I encountered this message:**

```
$ sass bootstrap-flex.scss bootstrap-flex.css
/usr/local/lib/ruby/gems/2.4.0/gems/sass-3.4.23/lib/sass/util.rb:1109: warning: constant ::Fixnum is deprecated
```

## Setup

bootstrap-4.0.0-alpha.5

**Sass version:**
`Sass 3.4.23 (Selective Steve)`

**Ruby version:**
`ruby 2.4.0p0 (2016-12-24 revision 57164) [x86_64-darwin16]`

issue.title: Cannot install Jekyll since v3.5 release
issue.body:
I use Jekyll + TravisCI to deploy a website. ~12 hours ago this was working, however now my automated build process hangs with what appears to be a conflict with "listen". If I run "gem install sass:3.4.25 jekyll" instead of "gem install jekyll", it works fine.


Here's what happens with an untouched base Google Compute Engine image as well:

$ cat /proc/version
Linux version 3.16.0-4-amd64 (debian-kernel@lists.debian.org) (gcc version 4.8.4 (Debian 4.8.4-1) ) #1 SMP Debian 3.16.43-2+deb8u1 (2017-06-18)

$ \curl -sSL https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable --ruby
[truncated]

$ rvm use 2.4.1 --install --fuzzy
[truncated]

$ ruby --version
ruby 2.4.1p111 (2017-03-22 revision 58053) [x86_64-linux]

$ gem install jekyll
Fetching: public_suffix-2.0.5.gem (100%)
Successfully installed public_suffix-2.0.5
Fetching: addressable-2.5.1.gem (100%)
Successfully installed addressable-2.5.1
Fetching: colorator-1.1.0.gem (100%)
Successfully installed colorator-1.1.0
Fetching: rb-fsevent-0.10.2.gem (100%)
Successfully installed rb-fsevent-0.10.2
Fetching: ffi-1.9.18.gem (100%)
Building native extensions.  This could take a while...
Successfully installed ffi-1.9.18
Fetching: rb-inotify-0.9.10.gem (100%)
Successfully installed rb-inotify-0.9.10
Fetching: sass-listen-3.0.7.gem (100%)
Successfully installed sass-listen-3.0.7
Fetching: sass-3.5.0.gem (100%)
Successfully installed sass-3.5.0
Fetching: jekyll-sass-converter-1.5.0.gem (100%)
Successfully installed jekyll-sass-converter-1.5.0
Fetching: listen-3.0.8.gem (100%)
listen's executable "listen" conflicts with sass-listen
Overwrite the executable? [yN]
